channel.title: Behance Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance

item.title: ITI Computers
item.description: ITI Computers is an established software company which focuses on the development of complex business solutions for tourism industry. Bunch was asked to redesign the identity and create a branding for Diventa, their most successful product. Identity was applied on stationery, folders and range of other promotional materials, including a brochure for Diventa which features three different covers.
item.content:encoded: ITI Computers is an established software company which focuses on the development of complex business solutions for tourism industry. Bunch was asked to redesign the identity and create a branding for Diventa, their most successful product. Identity was applied on stationery, folders and range of other promotional materials, including a brochure for Diventa which features three different covers.

item.title: "Steve Maobs": Unused Fortune Magazine Cover
item.description: An unused cover concept for Fortune Magazine, merging Steve Jobs and Chairman Mao into a single iconic figure.
item.content:encoded: An unused cover concept for Fortune Magazine, merging Steve Jobs and Chairman Mao into a single iconic figure.

item.title: Lomas i5 beach house
item.description: BEACH HOUSE I-5, Las Lomas del Mar PERÚ Location: Las Lomas del Mar Beach, Km 120 lima south Size: bilt área 250m² Client: private Project on web: http://www.verticearquitectos.com/proyectos/vivienda_temporal/2010_casa-de-playa_las-lomas_i05.html This house was designed in the first row, plot 5 in Lomas del Mar beach in Cerro Azul, 120Km. south of Lima. The plot is a rocky and sandy hill in a half curved shape that reaches 48 meters high above the sea level and drops steeply 8 meters in its lowest part. It has a 180° view to the Pacific Ocean to the south, and a panoramic view of the beach to the east and to the north. The two main goals to develop the project were to fully exploit the best possible view to the ocean from the social area, as well as from the master bedroom, and to make the most of the plot of land. Two parallel volumes were designed, to accomplish the first objective, one of which leans on the other, which is 1.20 meters higher, to have the view of the sea. The volumes are joined by a main circulation axis which ends in a swimming pool overlooking the beach. To make the most of the plot big cantilevers were designed, since the useful area of the plot was reducing while the project was reaching the highest level. . The first volume is found to the left of the entrance of the house, where most of the bedrooms have been located. The master room and the adjoining terrace are revolved 45° as to have the view of the sea. The second volume, to the right, locates the social and service areas in the first level. A family room and a guest room are located in the second level. A two-story living and dining room area ends in the swimming pool and in a terrace perpendicular to it. The family room, in the second level, is spatially opened to the living and dining room in the first level, and has also an open view to the ocean. The staircase to the second level is made in natural concrete and flies over the kitchen separating this area from the living and dining room. The materials used in the project have been: exposed concrete, white painting in the walls, stainless steel, tempered glass and granite stone. The latter has been used to cover the base on which the volumes rest, with the intention of separating these from the natural terrain. The pool is closed by a double face laminated glass in the external face that permits the same transparency to a view of the sea as the rest of the house. VÉRTICE ARQUITECTOS Aditional info: Arquitectura: VERTICE ARQUITECTOS Arq. Hernani Canessa, Arq. Luis Miguel Becerra, Arq. Sandro Moro Colaboradora: Arq. Joanna Ibarra Barack Estructuras: Ing. Carlos Salcedo e Ing. Jorge Haaker Constructor: Ing. Daniel Dongo

item.title: Olympisme - striving for London and beyond
item.description: Self financed book on all these (dutch) athletes striving to go to this once a 4 years manifestation for the best. An honor to go but the heart strives for this small stage where only three are allowed. We were happy and proud to work with them and get sometimes even 2-3 hours to create these beautiful in camera wonders of complete coorporation!! For you to see and judge - have as much fun as we had in creating this high end masterpiece of printing!! Tom
item.content:encoded: Self financed book on all these (dutch) athletes striving to go to this once a 4 years manifestation for the best. An honor to go but the heart strives for this small stage where only three are allowed. We were happy and proud to work with them and get sometimes even 2-3 hours to create these beautiful in camera wonders of complete coorporation!! For you to see and judge - have as much fun as we had in creating this high end masterpiece of printing!! Tom

item.title: Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select
item.description: Jack Daniels Sinatra Select is a special edition whiskey crafted to honor Frank Sinatras fifty-year friendship with Jack Daniels. Frank was a fiercely loyal, lifetime fan of the brand, and Sinatra Select was designed to be both a classic expression of style and an homage to two American icons. This exclusive outpouring of the distillers craft is matured in proprietary oak barrels for a bold flavor, timeless character and exceptional smoothness. Sinatra Select will be available at high-end retail stores and major airports worldwide, debuting in Las Vegas and later spreading to destinations including New York, London, Sydney and Singapore.
item.content:encoded: Jack Daniels Sinatra Select is a special edition whiskey crafted to honor Frank Sinatras fifty-year friendship with Jack Daniels. Frank was a fiercely loyal, lifetime fan of the brand, and Sinatra Select was designed to be both a classic expression of style and an homage to two American icons. This exclusive outpouring of the distillers craft is matured in proprietary oak barrels for a bold flavor, timeless character and exceptional smoothness. Sinatra Select will be available at high-end retail stores and major airports worldwide, debuting in Las Vegas and later spreading to destinations including New York, London, Sydney and Singapore.

item.title: Statoil

item.content:encoded: Statoil shoot by Jaap Vliegenthart. All images have the sockets, cables and gas pipes created in 3D, the underwater image is completely made in 3D. CGI and postproduction done by Souverein Weesp.

item.title: Lamp RIMA
item.description: Based on the metaphor of a window curtain, tangible action has been implemented into RIMAs design. Depending on how far and where the user draws that curtain, the illumination of the room will change. Thus, the user can actively decide the amount and the position of the light incidence. The rings, almost floating along the light rail, put two metaphors in redundancy, aiming directly at the motor function of the human hands: drawing curtains and moving balls on an analog calculator, a so called abacus. A lit area is drawn directly by hand. Sitting on top of the desk surface on thin poles, the illuminant reminds of a classic neon tube in grasping height, giving RIMA a semantic touch.
item.content:encoded: Based on the metaphor of a window curtain, tangible action has been implemented into RIMAs design. Depending on how far and where the user draws that curtain, the illumination of the room will change. Thus, the user can actively decide the amount and the position of the light incidence. The rings, almost floating along the light rail, put two metaphors in redundancy, aiming directly at the motor function of the human hands: drawing curtains and moving balls on an analog calculator, a so called abacus. A lit area is drawn directly by hand. Sitting on top of the desk surface on thin poles, the illuminant reminds of a classic neon tube in grasping height, giving RIMA a semantic touch.

item.title: PF Din Text Pro
item.description: The Din Text series was based on the original standards but was completely redesigned to fit typographic requirements. Completed in 2002, it was first released in 2003 and published as a group of 4 separate families each with 12 weights. The Din Text Pro series is an improved version which has been enhanced with more weights, multilingual support and opentype features.
item.content:encoded: The Din Text series was based on the original standards but was completely redesigned to fit typographic requirements. Completed in 2002, it was first released in 2003 and published as a group of 4 separate families each with 12 weights. The Din Text Pro series is an improved version which has been enhanced with more weights, multilingual support and opentype features.

item.title: Type Has Muscles
item.description: Type Has Muscles this project is self-initiated. I love to do typography experiments and also love the shape of Muscle cars so this is my little effort to combine these two components with abstraction.
item.content:encoded: Type Has Muscles this project is self-initiated. I love to do typography experiments and also love the shape of Muscle cars so this is my little effort to combine these two components with abstraction.

item.title: MTV EMA 2012
item.description: We created and directed a 20 second sequence, and opener, bumper and closer alterations from 2 to 20 seconds length, revolving around a huge Zoetrope, a fast-moving carousel which evokes the illusion of motion through a fast succession of static elements which come to life with a stroboscopic light.
item.content:encoded: We created and directed a 20 second sequence, and opener, bumper and closer alterations from 2 to 20 seconds length, revolving around a huge Zoetrope, a fast-moving carousel which evokes the illusion of motion through a fast succession of static elements which come to life with a stroboscopic light.

item.title: Diverza.
item.description: Identity redesign + branding system + web design for the premium electronic invoice supplier in Mexico. Diverza is the leader in electronic + online invoice services in Mexico. Their philosophy and work process is reflected by the simplicity and practical approach of their new identity. The design itself communicates both the human side and the technology-driven services. With modern design, we created the basic canvas for their expertise and innovation to flow the right way. 2012
item.content:encoded: Identity redesign + branding system + web design for the premium electronic invoice supplier in Mexico. Diverza is the leader in electronic + online invoice services in Mexico. Their philosophy and work process is reflected by the simplicity and practical approach of their new identity. The design itself communicates both the human side and the technology-driven services. With modern design, we created the basic canvas for their expertise and innovation to flow the right way. 2012

item.title: Smallest cafe place in North America, visual identity
item.description: The Distributrice reinvents the takeout coffee service by taking over the smallest commercial space in Montréal. Next to one of the most popular subway station, a barista serves you espresso, americano and latté directly on the street.

item.title: Día de Muertos 2012
Nike 100
item.description: Debuting at the 2008 Beijing Olympics and traveling to 100% Design in Tokyo, the Nike 100 described the history of the Nike brand through 100 quintessential artifacts that embody the unrelenting pursuit of lightness and speed. We designed the architecture and interiors, oversaw production of the 9,000 sq ft exhibition space, and authored and curated all content including dynamic installations, film, and interactive media. An iPod-based navigation system allowed each user to define their own path through the exhibit, and hear the voices of the designers and athletes that made sports history. Located in Beijing's 798 Arts Space, the exhibition doubled as a social gathering spot and a venue for design lectures, talks and symposia. Finally we organized a national student project that involved design students from the top art academies in China contributing to a special crowd-sourced catalogue.
item.content:encoded: Debuting at the 2008 Beijing Olympics and traveling to 100% Design in Tokyo, the Nike 100 described the history of the Nike brand through 100 quintessential artifacts that embody the unrelenting pursuit of lightness and speed. We designed the architecture and interiors, oversaw production of the 9,000 sq ft exhibition space, and authored and curated all content including dynamic installations, film, and interactive media. An iPod-based navigation system allowed each user to define their own path through the exhibit, and hear the voices of the designers and athletes that made sports history. Located in Beijing's 798 Arts Space, the exhibition doubled as a social gathering spot and a venue for design lectures, talks and symposia. Finally we organized a national student project that involved design students from the top art academies in China contributing to a special crowd-sourced catalogue.
